conbody.p: Use the following parameters to generate XLIFF files for a project from the command line:

row.entry: Full path to a JSON file containing the data required for generating XLIFF files.
Selects whether progress information is logged or not in stdout.

conbody.p: Where the content of genXLIFF.json should be like:
conbody.codeblock: { "id": 12345678, "xliffFolder": "C:\\sample data\\XLIFF", "tgtLang": [ "es", "fr" ], "ditaval": "C:\\sample data\\filter.ditaval", "useICE": true, "modifiedFilesOnly": true, "useTM": true, "generateCount": false, "version": 2.0, "paragraph": false, "ignoreTrackedChanges": false, "ignoreSVG": true, "embedSkeleton": false }

row.entry: Path to the folder where XLIFF files and optional word counts should be stored
An array containing the target languages for the XLIFF files
Path to a .ditaval file for filtering the content to be extracted
Selects wheteher existing ICE matches should be reused. Default false
Selects wether topics that have not changed since the last translation cycle should be included in the generated XLIFF files. Default value: false
Selects whether translation memories should be used. Default value: false
Selects whether word counts should be generated. Default value: false
Selects the version of XLIFF to generate. Values: 1.2, 2.0 or 2.1. Default value: 2.0
Selects wether paragraph segmentation should be used instead of sentence segmentation. Default value: false
Selects wether tracked changes from Oxygen XML Editor should be ignored. Default value: false
Selects wether translatable SVG files should be ignored when generating XLIFF. Default value: false
Selects whether skeletons should be embedded in the generated XLIFF files, allowing conversion back to DITA in any computer using OpenXLIFF Filters or XLIFF Manager. Default value: false
